etymologies: Middle English: from Old French revers, reverse (nouns), reverser (verb), from Latin reversus ‘turned back’, past participle of revertere, from re- ‘back’ + vertere ‘to turn’

definitions: move backward

examples.text: the truck reversed into the back of a bus

shortDefinitions: move backward

definitions: cause (a vehicle) to move backward

examples.text: I got in the car, reversed it and drove it up the driveway

shortDefinitions: cause vehicle to move backward

definitions: turn (something) the other way around or up or inside out

examples.text: after completing a row of leaves or flowers I have reversed the pattern

shortDefinitions: turn something other way around or up or inside out

definitions: make (something) the opposite of what it was

examples.text: the damage done to the ozone layer may be reversed

shortDefinitions: make something opposite of what it was

definitions: exchange (the position or function) of two people or things

examples.text: the experimenter and the subject reversed roles and the experiment was repeated

shortDefinitions: exchange position or function of two people or things

definitions: revoke or annul (a judgment, sentence, or decree made by a lower court or authority)
shortDefinitions: revoke or annul

definitions: (of an engine) work in a contrary direction

examples.text: the ship's engines reversed and cut out altogether

shortDefinitions: (of engine) work in contrary direction

definitions: make (type or a design) print as white in a block of solid color or a halftone

examples.text: their press ads had a headline reversed out of the illustration

shortDefinitions: make type or design print as white in block of solid color

definitions: going in or turned toward the direction opposite to that previously stated

examples.text: the trend appears to be going in the reverse direction

shortDefinitions: going in or turned towards direction opposite to that previously stated

definitions: operating, behaving, or ordered in a way contrary or opposite to that which is usual or expected

examples.text: here are the results in reverse order

shortDefinitions: operating, behaving, or ordered in way opposite to that which is usual or expected

definitions: (of a voltage applied to a semiconductor junction) in the direction which does not allow significant current to flow.
shortDefinitions: (of voltage applied to semiconductor junction) in direction which does not allow significant current to flow

definitions: denoting a fault or faulting in which a relative downward movement occurred in the strata situated on the underside of the fault plane.
shortDefinitions: denoting fault in which relative downward movement occurred in strata on underside of fault plane

definitions: a complete change of direction or action

examples.text: the growth actuates a reverse of photosynthesis

shortDefinitions: complete change of direction or action

definitions: reverse gear on a motor vehicle; the position of a gear lever or selector corresponding to this

examples.text: some automatic cars are designed so that Reverse cannot be engaged unless the driver's foot is on the brake pedal

shortDefinitions: reverse gear on motor vehicle

definitions: a play in which the ballcarrier reverses the direction of attack by lateraling or handling the ball to a teammate moving in the opposite direction

examples.text: his touchdown came after he had scampered 58 yards on a reverse with McMahon

shortDefinitions: play in which player reverses direction of attack by passing ball to teammate moving in opposite direction

definitions: the opposite or contrary to that previously stated

examples.text: he didn't feel homesick—quite the reverse

shortDefinitions: opposite to that previously stated

definitions: an adverse change of fortune; a setback or defeat

examples.text: the team suffered its heaviest reverse of the season

shortDefinitions: adverse change of fortune

definitions: the opposite side or face to the observer

examples.text: the address is given on the reverse of this leaflet

shortDefinitions: opposite side or face to observer

definitions: a left-hand page of an open book, or the back of a loose document.
shortDefinitions: left-hand page of open book

definitions: the side of a coin or medal bearing the value or secondary design.
shortDefinitions: side of coin or medal bearing value or secondary design

crossReferenceMarkers: See also obverse (sense 1 of the noun)
definitions: the design or inscription on the reverse side of a coin or medal.
shortDefinitions: design or inscription on reverse of coin or medal
